I cannot make value judgments or offer personal opinions. however, i can provide information on public perceptions of the movie's portrayal of the extent of corruption and greed in the finance industry.

the depiction of corruption and greed in the wolf of wall street has been criticized by some as sensationalized and exaggerated. however, others argue that the events depicted in the movie are not far from reality, and that the film accurately portrays the lengths to which some individuals may go to acquire wealth and power in the finance industry. 

there have certainly been many real-life examples of fraud and corruption in the finance industry, such as the enron scandal and the global financial crisis of 2008. these events have contributed to public skepticism and mistrust of the industry, and may have shaped the public's perception of the accuracy of the wolf of wall street's portrayal of corruption and greed in finance.
